project.teaser: To restore and protect ocean ecosystems within a sustainable blue economy, in line with the objectives of the Mission ‘Restore Our Ocean and Waters by 2030’, we urgently need new business models for regenerative aquaculture, informed by best scientific evidence on...
project.objective:
To restore and protect ocean ecosystems within a sustainable blue economy, in line with the objectives of the Mission ‘Restore Our Ocean and Waters by 2030’, we urgently need new business models for regenerative aquaculture, informed by best scientific evidence on environmental impacts and developed in partnership with societal stakeholders. To encourage adoption, such practices must be technically, operationally, and economically viable for ocean farmers, with clear benefits to ecosystem services, community resilience, market potential and job creation. C-FAARER will deliver a roadmap and guidance, co-designed with stakeholders, to support ocean farmers in the Atlantic and Arctic Sea basin to develop community-driven business models for regenerative ocean farming and policymakers to take enabling actions.
C-FAARER builds on prior EU projects, reviewing evidence on socio-economic and environmental impacts and successful community business models to establish a robust case for adoption. Working with ocean farmers and coastal communities at sites in Norway and Ireland, we will analyse technical, operational, economic, environmental, and social needs and create guidance on developing site-specific community-led business plans. We will co-design feasibility reports and evidence-based business plans with members of the Norwegian Seaweed Association cluster of 80+ ocean farmers, replicate lessons via a new Irish Seaweed Association and ensure long-term sustainability through a new Community of Practice on the established Connecting Nature Enterprise Platform. Policy recommendations will highlight barriers, supports and investments needed from local, national and EU authorities to strengthen and scale regenerative community-led aquaculture in the Atlantic and Arctic Sea basin. Clustering and engagement with Ocean Mission projects and partner networks will identify opportunities to embed community-led business models for regenerative aquaculture in future Mission actions.
project.title: Community-driven Farming for the Atlantic and Arctic sea basins through REgeneRative aquaculture

article.title: Discover the EU-funded projects supporting Europe’s climate-neutral future
article.teaser: The new CORDIS Synergy Info Pack on Delivering growth and the green transition highlights how projects coming from different countries, sectors and funding programmes are all working towards the same shared goal: delivering the European Green Deal and its commitment to a climate-neutral future that benefits everyone.

article.teaser: The European Green Deal is the EU’s commitment to lead the way on climate action and to shape a green transition that benefits citizens and industries. It’s a commitment to reduce net greenhouse gas emissions by at least 55 % by 2030, and to become the world’s first climate-neutral continent.

result.title: Policy white paper with recommendations and a roadmap for Ocean Mission actions
result.description: Presentation of the rationale and conceptual framework and a summary of opportunity to scale the regenerative farming system in Europe.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - C-FAARER (Community-driven Farming for the Atlantic and Arctic sea basins through REgeneRative aquaculture)
result.teaser: Europe faces considerable challenges to achieve the objectives of the EU Mission ‘Restore Our Ocean and Waters by 2030’. C-FAARER contributed to the Mission by responding to the pressing issue of unsustainable ocean farming practices, which are largely commercially-driven...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Dissemination, Exploitation & Communication Plan
result.description: The DEC Plan will include agreed activities, roles and dates for dissemination and communication of the results of the C-FAARER project. It will target both new and identified key stakeholder groups and initiatives, specifying actions to reach different groups with measurable KPIs.

result.title: Conceptual Framework for Regenerative Ocean Farming
result.description: Desk-based research report in the form of a discussion paper to define the scope and technical key success factors of regenerative farming operations and generate initial insights into strategies and tools that could support new entrants, new market creation and business cases for community-based investment and scaling.

result.title: Feasibility Assessments
result.description: Reports on preliminary feasibility assessments covering farming, business and environmental issues.

result.title: NSA Cluster Insights Report - Socio-Economic and Business
result.description: Case studies of NSA members' business and community engagement practices and outcomes to provide business and socio-economic insights for development of recommendations.

result.title: Project Website and link to CNEP platform
result.description: The C-FAARER website will be live and links to the relevant community on the CNEP (Connecting Nature Enterprise Platform) will be operational.

result.title: Data Management Plan (Ongoing)
result.description: Strategy adopted (and updated) for data handling and sharing throughout the duration of the project along with future data management plans as required for ongoing activities arising from the CSA.

result.title: Framework and Vision Report and Presentation Materials
result.description: Translation of C-FAARER framework and vision into visual outputs and communication materials for dissemination.

result.title: Practice guidebook supporting new ventures into regenerative ocean farming
result.description: Synthesis of outputs and cases, providing insights and guidance for social and environmental innovators and entrepreneurs.

result.title: NSA Cluster Insights Report - Value Chains
result.description: Case studies of NSA members' seaweed processing, opportunities arising from new technologies and key value chain partnerships.

details.authors: Maribu, Ingrid; Blikra, Marthe Jordbrekk; Eilertsen, Karl-Erik; Elvevold, Kjetil

result.title: Data Management Plan (Initial)
result.description: Proposed strategy for data handling and sharing throughout the duration of the project.

result.title: NSA Cluster Insights Report - Technical and Operational
result.description: Case studies of NSA members' regenerative practices and products to provide technical and site-specific insights for development of recommendations.

result.title: Feasibility and Innovation Assessments – Markets and Value Chains
result.description: Report on overall feasibility of existing and emerging processing and value chain practices, with a specific focus on opportunities to exploit technology for increasing value and reducing risk.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
